title: CLAUDE.md
text:
CLAUDE.md
Use AGENTS.md as the primary operating guide for this repository.
Key points:

Edit source on master.
Do not hand-edit gh-pages; deployment is automated.
Main content files: index.qmd, research.qmd, teaching.qmd, contact.qmd.
Style file: styles.css.
PDF assets live in papers/.
Add PDF links using relative paths like papers/filename.pdf.
Do not rewrite prose unless explicitly requested; prefer layout/styling-only edits.
Deployment workflow: .github/workflows/publish.yml.

title: Agent Instructions
text:
This repository is the source for nicholas-reynolds.com.



Keep editable source on master.
The rendered static site is deployed automatically to gh-pages via GitHub Actions.
Do not edit gh-pages by hand except for emergency recovery.





_quarto.yml: site config, navbar, theme wiring, and static resources.
index.qmd, research.qmd, teaching.qmd, contact.qmd: page content.
styles.css: typography, spacing, card styles, and mobile tweaks.
papers/: PDF assets that must remain accessible on the live site.
.github/workflows/publish.yml: render + deploy workflow.





Do not rewrite prose by default. Only change wording when the user explicitly requests text edits.
For layout-only requests, keep existing copy verbatim and only modify structure/styling/link presentation.
Update biography, affiliations, links, and featured paper placement on index.qmd when requested.
Update publications and paper links on research.qmd when requested.
Keep PDF filenames stable when possible to avoid broken links.
Add new PDFs under papers/ and link to them with relative paths such as papers/filename.pdf.
If adding a custom domain, store it in a root CNAME file on master; the workflow will copy it to _site/CNAME.





Render locally: quarto render
Preview locally: quarto preview





Preserve existing PDFs in papers/ unless explicitly removing deprecated files.
If deployment changes are needed, edit .github/workflows/publish.yml, not GitHub UI defaults.

title: Nicholas Reynolds
text:
I’m a labor and health economist at the University of Essex.
Much of my research focuses on the health and human capital of Americans and innovation.

CV Google Scholar University Profile Email






2025 | AER: Insights lead article. The Broad Decline in Health and Human Capital of Americans Born after 1947.
2025 | AEA Featured Chart. Figure 1 selected as an AEA Featured Chart.
Oct 2025 | LSE Business Review. What caused the American decline of the past 60 years?.
Aug 2024 | Commentary. Marginal Revolution and Bloomberg Opinion.










American Economic Review: Insights (Lead article)
Links: Journal version | Working paper version





Journal of Human Resources
Links: Journal version | Working paper version | Appendices





With Ina Ganguli (UMass Amherst) and Jeffrey Lin (Philadelphia Fed)
American Economic Journal: Applied Economics

With Sam Arenberg (Houston) and Sam Stripling





With Michel Serafinelli (KCL)





With Jeffrey Lin (Philadelphia Fed) and Bryan Stuart (Philadelphia Fed)








Much longer version of what became the AER: Insights paper. Also includes results that turned into the “Stunted Adolescence” and “Local Average Cohort Effects” working papers, plus additional material.
